title: A1534 - 820-00045 no power
message:
Hi,

I have an A1534 - 820-00045 that has no power.

It puls 5.15V and 0.05A from ampmeter, but only with one side of the USB. Already tried new power flex cable but with same result.

PPBUS_G3H = 8.59V
PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H = 5.1V
PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS = 8.59V
PPVBUS_E85 = 5.1V
PPDCIN_G3H = 5.1V
PP3V3_G3H = 3.3V
PP3V3R3V0_AON = 2.940V
PPVRTC_G3H = 3.2V
PP5V_G3H_LDO = 4.9V
PP5V_S4 = 4.9V
PP3V3_S5 = 3.2V
PP1V05_SUS = 1.055V
PP3V3_SUS = 3.2V

PP5V_S0 = 0V and 0.420 on diode reading.

Can you help?

title: A1534 - 820-00045 no power
message:
Any history available?

I do not recommend bothering with this MLB.
All of them end with dead CPU.
Then client comes back to you, even your repair wasn't CPU related...

title: A1534 - 820-00045 no power
message:
Client says it stoped working. He shut it down at night, and in the morning it was dead.

Is there any way to be sure it is CPU?

title: A1534 - 820-00045 no power
message:
Check diode mode to ground on all coils; compare with good board.
Difficult to diagnose CPU, if you don't get some bad readings related with CPU.

title: A1534 - 820-00045 no power
message:
Hi,  

diode mode to ground on all coils is identical with other board. 

Is there anything else I can do?

title: A1534 - 820-00045 no power
message:
Any S3 voltage present?
PM_SLP_S4_L goes high?
What about PM_SLP_S3_L?

title: A1534 - 820-00045 no power
message:
Hi,

PP1V8_S3 = 0V
PP1V2_S3 = 0V

No S3 line has voltage present.

PM_SLP_S4_L  = 0V

PM_SLP_S3_L  = 0V

title: A1534 - 820-00045 no power
message: No reaction on them when trigger SMC_ONOFF_L?

title: A1534 - 820-00045 no power
message:
yes,  

PM_PWRBTN_L drops from 3.2V to 0.358V, when triggering SMC_ONOFF_L

title: A1534 - 820-00045 no power
message:
Then PCH problem.
Check its RTC signals, if you want to spend more time.
